subject: The Old Knight...
event:
... is an experienced master at arms,
 
... has been a colonel, a doctor, a friar, a nazi, a sergeant, a superintendant, a corporal, and a minister,
 
... knows Cersei, Eddard, Ser Jorah, and Pussy Galore.

Just sayin'

comments.article:
*chuckles*
It would be awesome if you'd managed to talk Sean Connery out of retirement for the role :D

God if you got Sean Connery to be the Old Knight I'd die XD

I know that's likely waaaay off the mark, but hell it would be fun XD
I love your avatar!  I'd love to get that on a button or bumper sticker!
Please tell me that Sean Connery is Ser Barristan Selmy.
I love your icon. It wins.
That would be SO perfect!
Makes me think of Walder Frey, but this description could probably be applied to a lot of people. =p
As much as I'd love to say Sean Connery, thats just too obvious. T_T but it would be amazing.

You got Derek Jacobi! He will be brilliat as Ser Baristan. He was the Master on Doctor Who. The Friar is Brother Cadfael. He's performed with Honor Blackman, Sean Bean, Lena Hedley, etc. etc. This cast keeps getting better and better.
comments.subject: I can't believe it!

comments.article: That would also be freaking awesome :D
comments.subject: Re: I can't believe it!

comments.article:
Well, we got a clue that's a little tougher to Google.

And, frankly, I don't really want to see the matches I get when I google for "pussy galore".
I think that Cillian Murphy's character in "Breakfast on Pluto" was named Pussy Galore as well.
Pete Postlethwaite?  I love him!
I'm also thinking/hoping that he'll be played by Sean Connery. (Wow!)

Pussy Galore was the chick in a Roger Moore Bond flick....Octopussy. Perhaps the only time Moore made a good Bond film.

Sigh.....Don't worry, George....I'll guess your Barristan......(or am I the one who is way off now?)
comments.subject: You guys are way off

comments.article: Pussy Galore is a female stunt pilot in Goldfinger, with Sean Connery. The character in Octopussy is called exactly that, hence the title.
comments.subject: Re: You guys are way off
Re: You guys are way off
Re: You guys are way off

comments.article: It's probably Alun Armstrong, the actor connections seem to exist (checked only 3 of them I think), and browsing through his imdb I see a role as a Superintendent and as a pastor (also as sergeant and corporal)

I think its Armstrong as well. The only person I can't directly connect him to is Iain Glen. However, they have both been in the Royal Shakespeare Company, and maybe that's close enough to satisfy GRRM's clues.

He worked with Headey on Onegin, Bean on Patriot Games, and has appeared in "New Tricks" with Honor Blackman (aka Pussy Galore).

As far as Jacobi go, if George had added "emperor" to the list of occupations... But I've got I, Claudius on the brain. Anyways, I don't believe it's him, though he'd certainly be more than up to the part.

Only the pilot is being cast, folks. Barristan doesn't show up. It's Ser Rodrik Cassel, certainly. I doubt it's Connery, very much -- he's retired from acting, and if he weren't, well, Ser Rodrik isn't exactly a huge role for him.
You're probably right, but let us dream!
With those credits it's either Connery or Tommy Lee.
Can't be connery?
comments.subject: The old knight

comments.upictitle: Frito: I am such a geek
comments.article: If Gert Frobe wasn't dead, I'd have guessed him. He actually was in the Nazi party and he played Auric Goldfinger. Alas, he is deceased.
Maybe they're taking a new spin on Ser Rodrik.
Looking through Michael Hogan's IMDB I noticed he had a number of the required titles in his various parts. I would also absolutely love him.

Furthermore, googling "Micheal Hogan and Sean Bean" revealed this little tidbit

"Brian Cox as Major Michael Hogan and Sean Bean as Richard Sharpe in "Sharpe's Eagle." Which could satisfy the knowledge department, in a way.

It has to be a brit-I vote Michael Caine-which would be epic.

No idea-I'm watching football.
comments.subject: Digs into beard which doesn't exist...

comments.article: What about Gen. Orlov from Octapussy? Steven Berkoff has been many things- a doctor, a Nazi (Hitler), a colonel (Russian in Rambo), a Sgt, a cpl (in 1959).
comments.subject: Steven Berkoff

comments.article:
Pussy Galore.

*snerk*

I'm voting for the Greyjoys to win the Game of Thrones.

House motto: "We do Not Sow"

To whit: check out Alestorm-a Pirate Metal Band I heard about on America's National Pirate Radio.

I will spare you the posting of a direct link.

Ahhhrrrrr!!
comments.subject: Also-fun fact

comments.article: Berkoff and Sean Bean in Patriot Games.

A final summation of Mozart's accurate solution to GRRM's riddles. I filled in a couple of blanks, so that there was no question about the accuracy. Speculation is that he will be playing Ser Rodrik Cassel.

RON DONACHIE . . .

. . . IS A SKILLED MASTER AT ARMS
- Played the Master at Arms in "Titanic" (1997)

. . . PLAYED A COLONEL
- Played Colonel J.S. Wilson in "Max Manus" (2008)

. . . PLAYED A DOCTOR
- Played Doctor Ferguson in "The Daisy Chain" (2008)

. . . PLAYED A FRIAR
- Played Friar Tuck in "Ivanhoe" (1997)

. . . PLAYED A NAZI
- Played Martin Bormann in "Uncle Adolf" (2005)

. . . PLAYED A SERGEANT
- PLayed Sergeant Scott in "Fierce Creatures" (1997)

. . . PLAYED A SUPERINTENDENT
- Played Superintendent Brent in "Supply & Demand (1997)

. . . PLAYED A CORPORAL
- Played an RAF corporal in "Crossing to Freedom"

. . . PLAYED A MINISTER
- Played a minister in "Sea of Souls" (2007)

. . . KNOWS NED (SEAN BEAN)
- Acted together in "Extremely Dangerous" (1999)

KNOWS CERSEI (LENA HEADEY)
- Acted together in "Jungle Book" (1990)

KNOWS SER JORAH (IAIN GLEN)
- Acted together in "Man to Man" (2005)

KNOWS PUSSY GALORE (HONOR BLACKMAN)
- Acted together in "Summer Solstice" (2005)

...ryan

Amazing Ryan. Ser Rodrik would seem likely...good show.

Also, keep in mind that according to Ian Flemming, Pussy Galore is always Mr. M's secretary. Knowing that may put a new light on the Swokowski brothers use of the name Pussy Funny as The Frenchman's girl in The Matrix.
Sean Connery?
